column3: When updating FuzzedDataProvider, please include the exact commit id that it was updated to
@MarcoFalke Thanks for reviewing! Feedback addressed. Please re-review :)

Would be helpful to comment on "why" in each commit message - e.g. I was curious to look into why the `FuzzedDataProvider.h` update was necessary and found that the `ConsumeFloatingPoint` was introduced [recently](https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/commit/df3b465c9c4fed5045470d3eb5b65c14e6de71e6#diff-09bd829935aa18be3ed32f464a607c3bR211-R214). https://chris.beams.io/posts/git-commit/#why-not-how
Why can this not be run in `case 0`? Seems odd to require the fuzzer to pick a path, when both of them can be run subsequently
Why are the nullptr things under `case 2` and `case 3`? Seems odd to put them there, when nothing needs to be parsed. They can be executed outside of any `case`, no?
Same here and for all cases below
